question.title: Setting the max buffer size for WebSocketClient since upgrading to Jetty 12
question.body:
As part of a risk remediation exercise, it has been discovered that we are still using Jetty v9.4.51xxx version of Jetty for our web sockets proxy application, and so should tackle the upgrading of this to v12.0.16. Using the migration guides provided by Jetty:

  • https://jetty.org/docs/jetty/12/programming-guide/migration/94-to-10.html, and
  • https://jetty.org/docs/jetty/12/programming-guide/migration/11-to-12.html

...and referencing the deprecated lists for version 9, 10, 11:

  • https://javadoc.jetty.org/jetty-9/deprecated-list.html,
  • https://javadoc.jetty.org/jetty-10/deprecated-list.html,
  • https://javadoc.jetty.org/jetty-11/deprecated-list.html

...the upgrade has gone relatively smoothly, apart from one part. The code here:

import org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.api.*;
import org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.client.WebSocketClient;
//...    
 
private WebSocketClient createWebSocketClient(HttpClient httpClient, int maxFrameSize) {
    WebSocketClient webSocketClient = new WebSocketClient(httpClient);
    webSocketClient.setMaxBinaryMessageBufferSize(maxFrameSize);
    webSocketClient.setMaxTextMessageBufferSize(maxFrameSize);
    webSocketClient.getPolicy().setMaxBinaryMessageSize(maxFrameSize);
    webSocketClient.getPolicy().setMaxTextMessageSize(maxFrameSize);
    return webSocketClient;
}

...was updated due to WebSocketPolicy being deprecated, to:

private WebSocketClient createWebSocketClient(HttpClient httpClient, int maxFrameSize) {
    WebSocketClient webSocketClient = new WebSocketClient(httpClient);
    //now errors -> webSocketClient.setMaxBinaryMessageBufferSize(maxFrameSize);
    //now errors -> webSocketClient.setMaxTextMessageBufferSize(maxFrameSize);
    webSocketClient.setMaxBinaryMessageSize(maxFrameSize);
    webSocketClient.setMaxTextMessageSize(maxFrameSize);
    return webSocketClient;
}

...but now we don't have any implementation for setMaxBinaryMessageBufferSize() and setMaxTextMessageBufferSize() methods. Even when consulting the guides mentioned above, I couldn't find these mentioned in any deprecation list or in the migration guides.

I would assume that these are still required... Any ideas? Any suggestions on how this existing functionality that was in place when using Jetty version 9.4.51xxx can be still included since upgrading to Jetty 12. Many thanks in advance.
